title: Oxford Digital Marketing: Disruptive Strategy Programme
description:
[

Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)

Technologies such as artificial intelligence are reshaping the way businesses think about their marketing strategies, as well as how they choose to harness different channels.

The Oxford Digital Marketing: Disruptive Strategy Programme aims to provide you with the skills and confidence to respond to the forces driving disruption in the digital marketing landscape. You’ll investigate how consumer behaviour and media consumption have evolved, and develop strategies for adapting your marketing approach to account for this. Led by faculty from Saïd Business School, University of Oxford, you’ll also learn how to capitalise on the power of social media, and effectively use emerging technology and digital marketing channels in your strategy.

Develop a future-focused perspective on marketing as you learn to leverage data and analytics in your decision-making and create value in the face of disruption.

,

Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)

,

Led by faculty from Saïd Business School, University of Oxford, you’ll also learn how to capitalise on the power of social media, and effectively use emerging technology and digital marketing channels in your strategy.

,

Develop a future-focused perspective on marketing as you learn to leverage data and analytics in your decision-making and create value in the face of disruption.

,

]

what_will_learn: ['Insight into the use of emerging digital channels and technologies in marketing|', 'The skills to effectively analyse and leverage data to make impactful, data-driven decisions|', 'An integrated social media and digital marketing strategy based on your own organisational context|', 'Guidance from leading industry experts and Oxford Saïd faculty, and access to the official Oxford Executive Education Alumni group on LinkedIn|', '']
target_students: This Oxford Saïd programme is best suited to marketing managers working in leadership positions at digital agencies and other companies across industries| It’s also ideal for experienced professionals with a sound understanding of marketing principles who want to build on foundational training in digital and social media platforms with a programme centred on future-focused strategy development in an age of disruption| The content is specifically designed for those who want to harness digital innovation in marketing and understand the opportunities that emerging trends and technologies will bring to organisations or clients|
instructor|1|designation: Associate Dean of Research, L’Oréal Professor of Marketing and Director of the Oxford Future of Marketing Initiative, Saïd Business School, University of Oxford
instructor|2|designation: Managing Consultant, UCT Liberty Institute of Strategic Marketing
review|1|review: I have enjoyed this programme. It has been educational and informative, helping me to learn new skills and approaches that I can and will apply to my career. The mix of theory, frameworks, quizzes, group forums, and interviews from leading professionals in their fields made the modules easy to digest and relate to. Learning with others has further expanded my understanding, and the online support has been most helpful when needed.
short_description: Redefine your marketing strategy in an age of disruption.
additional_pricing_details: You can pay your course fees before the course starts, or you may opt for a split payment plan on courses that are nine weeks and shorter. For courses 10 weeks and longer, there is a three-part payment plan available.
institute: Saïd Business School, University of Oxford

title: Digital Marketing Analytics
description:
[

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

Digital technologies have reshaped marketing, leading to a drastic shift in the quality and quantity of information we can store, access, and analyze. This proliferation of data allows businesses to better understand and react to consumer patterns. However, it also increases the need to evolve measurement, planning, and implementation of their marketing activity. Companies require skilled professionals who are equipped to ensure optimal return on investment (ROI) for marketing spend, and to deliver valuable insights that drive better customer service.

The MIT Sloan Digital Marketing Analytics online short course unpacks how to leverage measurement and analysis within your digital marketing strategy. With a focus on analytics-based marketing, you will assess the latest applications of artificial intelligence, machine learning, and predictive modeling that will help drive ROI for campaigns.

,

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

,

Companies require skilled professionals who are equipped to ensure optimal return on investment (ROI) for marketing spend, and to deliver valuable insights that drive better customer service.

With a focus on analytics-based marketing, you will assess the latest applications of artificial intelligence, machine learning, and predictive modeling that will help drive ROI for campaigns.

review|1|review: Coming from a marketing background, I have some knowledge of digital marketing. However, taking this course through UCT unpacked the digital marketing work in-depth, and I feel this will definitely add value to my daily employment.

title: Digital Marketing
description:
[

Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)

An effective digital marketing strategy is key if you want to ensure that your brand remains visible and competitive in the modern market.

This University of Cape Town (UCT) Digital Marketing online short course will teach you how to reach the right audience by helping you to develop the online marketing skills you need to improve targeting and personalisation, and create a consistent cross-platform brand narrative. Over the course of 10 weeks, you’ll learn to develop an integrated digital strategy that uses the right tools for the right purposes and aligns internet marketing priorities with bottom-line business goals.

Win the war for attention and secure verifiable proof of your new digital marketing capabilities with an official certificate from UCT.

,

title: Social Media Strategy: Creating Engagement, Insight, and Action
description:
[

As social media evolves, it provides organizations with new and exciting ways to share their message and engage their audiences. However, to drive real action, they need to understand the science behind social media and the key to harnessing it effectively for business success.

The Social Media Strategy: Creating Engagement, Insight, and Action online short course from the MIT Sloan School of Management offers an in-depth look into the forces driving social media and how you can use them strategically to reach your organization’s goals.

Drawing on Sinan Aral’s book, The Hype Machine, you’ll gain an understanding of the technologies and trends impacting the social media landscape, as well as the neurological and economic factors that shape human behavior. Throughout this course, you’ll also learn about several powerful techniques to improve your social media marketing strategy. With guidance from MIT faculty and industry experts, you’ll walk away with the tools to leverage social media’s potential now and in the future.

,

Overall, I am beyond pleased with completing this course and am confident it will directly impact my future.

title: Brand Management
description:
[

Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)

Effective brand management strategies are invaluable to a business’s success, having a direct impact on its long-term growth and profitability.1

Professionals following brand management career paths are responsible for the perceptions customers hold about their brand. They develop brand management strategies to create favourable sentiments around their products and organisations. This strategic brand management course will allow you to learn from some of the brightest minds and biggest brands in South Africa, and give you the strategies you need to boost your brand management career in a landscape defined by digital and social media.

1 Ignyte Branding (Apr, 2019).

,

title: Public Relations (PR)
description:
[

Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)

The evolution of social and online media channels has caused a visible shift in the way we consume traditional media. As the communications landscape continues to change, businesses and brands must turn to public relations (PR) professionals to help control their public image in order to positively impact their bottom line.

Want to be recognised as a tactical and pre-emptive PR manager? The Public Relations online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) offers the perfect opportunity to enhance or launch your career in PR, by exploring the latest techniques and tactics for effective PR practice in a digital age. Over ten weeks, you’ll learn to create your own PR plan, and gain the confidence to build strong public relationships and communication strategies.

,

title: Copywriting for Online Marketing
description:
[

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

The success of an organisation’s online marketing material can be significantly enhanced by the work of a skilled copywriter. It’s the copywriter’s job to create persuasive, engaging content that captures an audience and inspires them to take action, and the University of Cape Town (UCT) Copywriting for Online Marketing online short course is designed to prepare you for this task.

Guided by an industry expert, you’ll learn to apply copywriting best practices and techniques, write compelling copy, headlines and calls-to-action for various online platforms, and develop a content marketing plan. You’ll also discover more about how copy can be changed to enhance search engine optimisation and how to price copywriting work.

Equipped with the tools to tackle writing in the dynamic digital landscape, you’ll have the foundation to become an invaluable asset to any company that needs to distinguish their brand or business online.

,

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

,

title: MarTech Strategy: Leveraging Data and Technology in Marketing
description:
[

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

Digitization in the field of marketing continues to intensify the need for businesses to develop a strategic, consolidated and collaborative approach to marketing technology. Forward-thinking organizations are recognizing the value in teaming marketing efforts with key technologies to create a seamless customer journey and strengthen their marketing imperatives. As its popularity grows, so does the potential to overwhelm users with various MarTech tools which, if used incorrectly, becomes an ineffective and costly expense. It is, therefore, vital that professionals approach their MarTech strategy with the in-depth knowledge to leverage MarTech in their context. Human insight and oversight are essential to ensuring that the MarTech stack is used successfully.

The MarTech: Leveraging Data and Technology in Marketing online short course from Medill at Northwestern University focuses on the six key components of marketing technology: advertising and promotion, content and experience, data and infrastructure, commerce and sales, customer relationship management and governance. It also offers key insights from contemporary case studies and expert guest lecturers in the industry. Over six weeks, you will explore how to combine and leverage MarTech stack capabilities and potential within your organization. At the end of the course, you will apply your learnings to develop a unique, innovative and forward-thinking MarTech business roadmap.

,

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

,

title: Marketing
description:
[

Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)

In an increasingly competitive business environment, companies need to make use of the latest brand management and promotional tactics to differentiate their offerings and attract target customers. Professionals with strong marketing skills can, therefore, play an important part in boosting an organisation’s bottom line.

The University of Cape Town (UCT) Marketing online short course covers the fundamentals of marketing management and offers a holistic view of this important field. You’ll learn how to set marketing goals, create buyer personas, and develop and implement a comprehensive strategy that incorporates digital marketing best practices while leveraging traditional channels. Throughout the course, you’ll receive detailed instruction from an engaged head tutor and have the chance to apply your learnings practically by making marketing decisions for a fictional business.

,

title: Social Media Marketing
description:
[

Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)

Social media has transformed the way in which businesses communicate with their customers. Once used predominantly for personal networking purposes, social channels are now recognised as key marketing tools, and organisations need a sound strategy in place in order to properly leverage these platforms for promotional success.

The University of Cape Town (UCT) Social Media Marketing online short course is designed to teach you how to develop such a strategy. It’ll introduce you to the South African social media marketing landscape and familiarise you with key principles and practical tools that you can use to boost your company’s social presence. You’ll learn how to manage a social media community and make use of social channels to drive sales and generate leads. Ultimately, you’ll walk away with a comprehensive social media marketing strategy that aligns with business objectives.

,

Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)

,

Social media has transformed the way in which businesses communicate with their customers. Once used predominantly for personal networking purposes, social channels are now recognised as key marketing tools, and organisations need a sound strategy in place in order to properly leverage these platforms for promotional success.

,

The University of Cape Town (UCT) Social Media Marketing online short course is designed to teach you how to develop such a strategy. It’ll introduce you to the South African social media marketing landscape and familiarise you with key principles and practical tools that you can use to boost your company’s social presence. You’ll learn how to manage a social media community and make use of social channels to drive sales and generate leads. Ultimately, you’ll walk away with a comprehensive social media marketing strategy that aligns with business objectives.

]

title: Customer Experience Innovation
description:
[

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

The Customer Experience Innovation online short course from Medill at Northwestern University is designed to expand your understanding of what drives positive customer interactions, allowing you to explore why these interactions are crucial in the current business landscape and to reveal how they can be shaped through dynamic marketing. This course will help you create relevant and personalized engagement at each point in the customer journey.

Over the course of six weeks, you will have the opportunity to use Northwestern Medill’s 5Cs framework (Content, Context, Calibration, Conversion and Collaboration) under the guidance of expert faculty. You will explore marketing technology (MarTech) and learn how to leverage it, along with data, to more efficiently and effectively acquire, retain and expand client relationships. On completion of this course, you will have the ability to align a MarTech strategy with your organization’s business objectives and a customer experience (CX) tool kit to create measurable business growth.

,

title: Product Management
description:
[

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

Effective product management requires expertise in a range of different business areas. Consequently, practitioners in this field must be well equipped to perform a number of different roles in order to ensure that their company delivers competitive products that align with consumer needs.

Through the Product Management online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT), you’ll gain a holistic understanding of all the steps involved in developing, branding, launching, and managing a viable product. More specifically, you’ll learn how to design a product strategy and comprehensive development road map, get familiar with the product innovation process, and create a go-to-market strategy for a new launch. In addition to these learnings, you’ll have the chance to collaborate and form professional networks with the other students on the course.

As the course content is relevant to many industries, you’ll find that you can apply the practical skills you learn in each module to various different business disciplines.

,

title: Content Marketing and Strategy: Brand and Business Growth
description:
[

In today's crowded digital marketing space, content is king. From the demands and expectations of consumers to technology and process advancements that support new levels of innovation, it is vital for marketers, businesses and brands to have the strategic tools to navigate this digitized business, economic and social space.

Explore the strategic potential of content marketing in the Content Marketing and Strategy online short course from Medill at Northwestern University. Over six weeks, you will discover how content can be used to achieve business goals and the key elements of an effective, brand-focused content marketing strategy. These include content writing, social media, analytics, visual narratives, storytelling, content management and digital innovation. Guided by Candy Lee, professor of marketing and journalism at Northwestern Medill, as well as industry experts, you will gain practical and critical thinking skills to drive an innovative content plan, define your marketing goals and set priorities to meet them. Finally, you will explore how emerging technologies and digital innovations impact content strategy, and how they can give your organization a competitive advantage.

,

title: Digital Marketing and Media Strategy
description:
[

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

The rapid evolution of the modern digital environment is widely recognized. From its nascent beginnings, the digital media landscape has grown exponentially. Today, brands must fight to be heard amongst a plethora of competitors and new platforms are emerging at an increasingly rapid speed. Marketing in this environment poses unique challenges, as it becomes necessary to adapt to new circumstances seemingly on the fly.

The Digital Marketing and Media Strategy online short course from Medill at Northwestern University equips you to face the modern media landscape by arming you with timeless principles of media strategy. These tools are highly adaptable, offering an integrated, audience-first approach to creating strategies that deliver on objectives and priorities. With guidance from Northwestern Medill faculty and industry experts, you will gain the ability to anticipate new challenges and seize new opportunities in digital media. You will learn to create your own digital media strategy, based on your newly informed understanding of the advantages and opportunities of various approaches and media marketplaces.

,

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

,

title: Market Research, Consumer Insights, and Competitor Analysis
description:
[

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

With the massive amount of consumer data available today, it has become increasingly important for businesses to adequately gather and analyse this information to succeed.

The Market Research, Consumer Insights, and Competitor Analysis online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) aims to equip you with the critical skills to interpret customer data and turn it into actionable business insights.

By exploring real-world cases, you’ll discover how market trends and business data can be interpreted and utilised in multiple scenarios and industries. As you gain the relevant tools to understand your market, competitors, and customers, you’ll become better equipped to shape a competitive, data-driven corporate identity, enabling you to respond to change more effectively. You’ll also learn how to conduct your own market research, and lead a team to do the same.

,

,

title: Digital Marketing: A Strategic Perspective
description:
[

Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)

Digital strategies, emerging technologies, and innovation have increasingly become the focus in modern marketing. It’s essential that businesses address any skills gaps and develop a fundamental understanding of how to generate value through customer-centric digital marketing.

During this eight-week program, you’ll explore how key digital marketing tools – including social media and mobile technology – can be leveraged to improve the consumer journey. Delve into the role experimentation and analytics play in enabling data-driven insights to empower decisions regarding the broader strategies of your organization.

,

title: Sales Management Program
description:
[

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

The role of sales within an organization has grown increasingly strategic and customer-centric. As more customers choose to conduct their research and purchasing journey online and via social media, sales professionals must rethink their approach to strategic engagement. The sales force requires updated skills and tools to better support and guide the informed buyer from their initial interest to the post-purchase experience. To do this effectively, sales teams require analytical and strategy-focused leaders to guide their operations and drive performance.

The Sales Management Program from SDA Bocconi School of Management aims to equip you with the ability to lead your team through a shifting landscape. Over the course of six weeks, you’ll learn how to action change management, digital transformation and performance management within your organization. You’ll develop the skills to run a customer portfolio analysis and evaluate the various strategies and approaches to building customer relationships. You’ll gain frameworks to assess team performance, provide feedback and design a compensation plan. Grow your knowledge and confidence as you explore conceptual models, real-world examples and decision-support tools while reflecting on your progress through journaling and in the online forums.

,

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

,

target_students: This program is for anyone looking to strategically manage sales in order to outsmart competitors, maintain or grow market share and reach ever-increasing targets| This includes sales managers who are used to working individually but want to gain the skills to lead a team as well as technical professionals who have moved into sales but lack managerial experience| The program would be particularly beneficial to sales managers in charge of a large team| They’ll learn how to improve their performance in their current position by taking a more strategic view of their function and role within the broader business| It is also useful to newly promoted sales managers, aspiring sales professionals and those ready to move to the next stage of their careers|

title: Product Marketing: Research, Consumer Behavior and Analytics
description:
[

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

As the business landscape evolves, establishing a customer-centric organization has become increasingly important to ensuring success. But, in order to do this, companies need professionals with the skills to turn the insights they gain from the immense volumes of consumer data available today into actions.

Gain the enhanced skills needed to understand customer expectations to improve decision-making in your organization in the Product Marketing: Research, Consumer Behavior and Analytics online short course from Medill at Northwestern University. Over six weeks, you will examine consumer buying habits and discover the underlying motivations that influence their relationship with a brand. You will also learn how to use exploratory, descriptive and predictive analytics to identify, target and engage customers to create more personalized product and service offerings. At the end of the course, you will walk away with the tools and techniques required to draw actionable insights from market research data, and develop a successful product strategy that will help drive business growth.

,

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

,

You will also learn how to use exploratory, descriptive and predictive analytics to identify, target and engage customers to create more personalized product and service offerings. At the end of the course, you will walk away with the tools and techniques required to draw actionable insights from market research data, and develop a successful product strategy that will help drive business growth.

title: AI-Driven Digital Marketing
description:
[

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

Artificial intelligence (AI) is fast becoming a core capability in customer experience improvement and process automation. Traditionally, marketing professionals focused on project execution and post-campaign performance analyses to gain insights. But today’s digital marketer can generate relevant, real-time engagement using AI-driven customer insights and proactive audience targeting. In this new environment, marketers must embrace innovation to respond to novel challenges while leveraging advanced analytics to understand customers better and enhance decision-making.

The six-week AI-Driven Digital Marketing online short course from Medill at Northwestern University investigates the development of AI and its growing applications in digital marketing. Led by expert faculty, you will explore ways to enrich the customer journey using personalized content marketing initiatives driven by advanced consumer insights. Throughout the course, you will assess how your organization should respond to AI innovation in marketing, culminating in the development of an AI-driven digital marketing strategy.

,

,

what_will_learn: ['An omnichannel, AI-driven digital marketing strategy that connects the needs of your customers with your organization’s goals|', 'The insight to identify challenges and opportunities presented by AI, including how best to plan for future AI innovation|', 'The ability to make accurate marketing-based, data-driven decisions|', 'The skills to determine how AI-driven insights can be used to leverage recommendation engines and align content creation with organizational goals| ', '']
target_students: This online short course is designed for professionals looking to improve their organizations’ digital marketing strategies by integrating AI solutions| Those in both technical and functional leadership roles, regardless of marketing duties, will benefit from a balanced overview of AI’s ability to improve the customer experience| IT, product and project managers leading operational and strategic initiatives will learn to articulate how AI-driven insights align customer needs with organizational goals| Marketing professionals interested in future role growth and improving their current role performance will learn from industry experts and validate their skills with a certificate of completion from Northwestern Medill|
short_description: Deliver a higher ROI using AI-driven digital marketing strategies tailored to your business and customer needs.
additional_pricing_details: You can pay your course fees before the course starts, or you may opt for a split payment plan on courses that are nine weeks and shorter. For courses 10 weeks and longer, there is a three-part payment plan available.

title: Search Engine Optimisation (SEO)
description:
[

Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)

Due to the rapid rise of digital technologies, new online and optimisation strategies are required. As a modern professional or business owner, understanding how to harness the power of search engine optimisation (SEO) to market your business is essential to supporting its online presence and ultimate success.

Ensure your business is as visible as possible in search engine results pages with the Search Engine Optimisation online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT).

This course aims to equip you with the skills to implement your own SEO tactics and strategies, giving you a competitive market advantage. You’ll gain fundamental principles and practical skills to drive more traffic to websites through SEO-optimised content. By practising on a live eCommerce Wordpress website, you’ll walk away with the ability to offer in-demand SEO services for clients, and boost your website’s ranking.

,

,
